page.title: 07YEAR 1912
page.content: Children left school to go to work at the age of twelve.They worked from 6.00 am for a few shillings a week the money was pounds,shillings and pence. Families were large,often 6 or 7 childen.The majority of families were poor.Clothes were shared with their sisters and brothers. Children wore clogs, if they had any shoes, they were allowed to wear them on a Sunday for church.They had one sweet a day if they were lucky enough. For Christmas they got an apple and an orange or sometimes a mince pie. Jam and bread was the main meal of the day. for breakfast they had porridge made with oat meal. In summer they sometimes had lettuce and in winter they had a boiled egg to share between two. sometimes they no food at all and drank water so they wouldn't go hungry.
